title: How Many Calories Are in Coffee?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in coffee (black, brewed), plus full nutrition breakdown, equivalents, and tweaks for additions like milk or sugar.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Coffee?
assumptions: Black brewed coffee, 8 oz (240 ml) serving, no sugar, milk, or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brewing method, bean type, and serving size; additives significantly increase calories. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of black coffee contains about 2 calories with negligible macros.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in black coffee?
Does coffee have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: Negligible—0 g carbs and 0.1 g protein per cup.

faqs.q: How do additives affect calories in coffee?
faqs.a: Sugar adds ~16 kcal/tsp; milk or cream can add 10–50+ kcal per serving.

faqs.q: Is decaf coffee lower in calories?
faqs.a: Similar to regular—about 2 kcal per cup, as calories come from the brew, not caffeine.

faqs.q: What about espresso or instant coffee calories?
faqs.a: Espresso: ~2 kcal/shot; instant: ~2–5 kcal per cup, depending on preparation.
